abstract: For small start-up networks, privacy is a selling point as Facebook users are becoming fed up with the site’s efforts to broadcast personal information.
snippet: For small start-up networks, privacy is a selling point as Facebook users are becoming fed up with the site’s efforts to broadcast personal information.
lead_paragraph: It sounds like a kamikaze mission: an upstart with a meager number of users and no capital squaring off against Facebook, a social networking juggernaut with more than 400 million members and a $15 billion valuation.

headline.main: Rivals Seize on Troubles of Facebook
headline.print_headline: Rivals Seize On Troubles Of Facebook
